entries.name: c_function
entries.desc: The C function that implements this method (if it was defined in a C file)

entries.name: call_seq
entries.desc: Different ways to call this method

entries.name: calls_super
entries.desc: If true this method uses super to call a superclass version

entries.name: new(text, name)
entries.desc: Creates a new AnyMethod with a token stream text and name

entries.name: add_alias(an_alias, context = nil)
entries.desc: Adds an_alias as an alias for this method in context.

entries.name: arglists()
entries.desc: The #call_seq or the #param_seq with method name, if there is no call_seq.

entries.name: call_seq=(call_seq)
entries.desc: Sets the different ways you can call this method.  If an empty call_seq is given nil is assumed.

entries.name: marshal_dump()
entries.desc: Dumps this AnyMethod for use by ri.  See also marshal_load

entries.name: marshal_load(array)
entries.desc: Loads this AnyMethod from array.  For a loaded AnyMethod the following methods will return cached values:

entries.name: param_list()
entries.desc: A list of this method's method and yield parameters.  call-seq params are preferred over parsed method and block params.

entries.name: param_seq()
entries.desc: Pretty parameter list for this method.  If the method's parameters were given by call-seq it is preferred over the parsed values.

entries.name: store=(store)
entries.desc: Sets the store for this method and its referenced code objects.

entries.name: superclass_method()
entries.desc: For methods that super, find the superclass method that would be called.
